dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I borrowed your toothbrush, and your shirt...

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: (wiping her mouth) No, thanks. I'll be asleep as soon as my head hits the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Me, too. Goodnight. ANNE. (calling him back) Remy. You didn't answer my question before.

dialogues.speaker: . REMY
dialogues.text: What. question?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Did: you. find something out tonight that you're not telling me?

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) No. . He exits, closing the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne is lying in bed with her eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Remy settles into his bed on the couch, then turns out. the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy's awake, too. He hears a soft metal-on-metal noise like a key in a lock; grabs his .38 off the coffee table and braces himself just inside the front door. The door opens and Remy hits the light switch.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Freeze. The light catches Bobby tiptoeing into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Jesus, you're gonna give me a heart attack before I'm twenty-one. :

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Be quiet. Anne's sleeping in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And you're sleeping on the couch?

dialogues.speaker: REMY"
dialogues.text: What's. it to you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Where am I supposed to sleep? Remy just picks up a single pillow fromithe couch and drops it onto the carpet. .

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: I thought you college kids liked sleeping on the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLAP OF THUNDER. Anne wakes, startled. For a second she doesn't know where she is, but then Remy's shirt reminds her. She gets out of bed, glances out the window---it's pouring rain--goes to the door. INT.. REMY'S APARTMENT-~SAME. Anne stumbles out of the bedroom, yawning and rubbing her eyes. Then stops, startled. 147 148 149

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNE's POV--THE KITCHEN 150 A male figure, naked, except for a pair of jeans, ‘bending over, looking into the refrigerator. Then he turns, grins--it's Remy. Bobby brusts into the room.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey, Remy is the coffee ready? Oh, hey, Annie! How ya doin? Remy throws an arm around Bobby's shoulders. REMY ‘ As a matter of fact, we're all out of coffee, Bobby. Remy steers him toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Why. don't you go out and get: some for us, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It's pouring out. Remy grabs. his trenchcoat from the back of the chair, throws it over Bobby's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: fake my raincoat, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don't have any money.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Here's. some money, Bobby. Take a cab to the farthest place you ean think of. Have a large breakfast. Take in a movie. Then give me a call.

Remy propels him right out the door, and shuts it. Turns around--no Anne. She's not in the kitches, she's not in the living room...He spots a cop shirt on the floor, in the doorway to the bedroom. He smiles, picks it up, steps into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lo The bed is neatly made. Anne is getting dressed, slipping back into her all-business mode. We've got to get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: | Absolutely. | He starts toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking down at the entrance to Remy's building, from a. rooftop across the way. The rain is~flooding down.. Bobby comes out of the building, wearing Remy's: trenchcoat: hurries: up the street. We follow him through our telescopic sight, the crosshairs centering ’ en his. back..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a BLUR OF NOTION crosses in front of the lens-- a truck passing on the street. The lens searches around, finds Bobby again. The lens shakes, recoiling from the CRACK of the rifle shot. The bullet. smashes. into Bobby like the blow from an ax--Bobby is. spun. around and thrown to the gutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy is galvanized by the sound of the rifle shot; crouches at the window on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. was. it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step back from the window!

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Dial 911, say shots fired, this address--tell them I'll be in the street

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Wait! . But Remy is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun in hand, Remy crouches in the entrance to his building. Down the block, near the Mini-mart, a erowd is gathering. Remy sprints toward the crowd of people. SIRENS are approaching. . Some of. the people notice Remy.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN CROWD
dialogues.text: He's got a gun!

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Police! Remy bursts through the crowd and sees Bobby lying on his back.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Oh, Cher.

dialogues.speaker: MAN. IN THE. CROWD
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND MAN
dialogues.text: No, look he's. breathing. Remy feels for a pulse then rips away the raincoat-- even though unconscious, Bobby groans formthe pain ef this. Bobby's been hit just below the shoulder blade on the right hand side; there's an exit would in front just below his ribs. Remy tries. to make a compress with his handkercheif to plug up the bleeding. Anne appears behind Remy as the first two police.cars scream onto the block.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Oh, Remy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TT - Anne! Reach here and hold this. Hold. it as tight as you can. Remy guides Anne's hand so that she takes his place holding the compress. Remy hurries away from Bobby's side to flag down the police cars. The lead car comes to. a smoking halt: inches from him.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Call in a possible sniper, this location! Open your rear doors! Remy and one of the PATROLMEN lift bobby up and into the back of the police car--Anne goes along, deeping the compress in place. She squeezes into the back of the police car, holding Bobby slumped up against her. Bobby's blood is. pumping all over Anne's dress. Remy pushes the patrolman DRIVER across the seat, jumps in. behind the wheel, accelerates away, SIREN HOWLING, as four more police cars. arrive, COPS jumping out, scanning the rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy, Anne, Mama, Uncle Sal, and Cousin Joey are waiting anxiously outside the Emergency Room Deor. Nobody's talking; there are lots of creshed cigarette butts on the floor. Remy has his arm around his mother. Kellom hurries in, looking distraught. Mama sees him, runs. into his. arms, crying. Kellom holds her tight, strokes her hair. Remy walks up. to them.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOM
dialogues.text: We'll get these bastards, Remy. I don't care what it takes.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: (voice trembling) I. want to talk to you, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA
dialogues.text: What is it, cher?

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Nothing, Mama. Police . business. He. pushes Kellom firmly toward the door. Anne watches, perplexed. Mama turns to her, worried.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA
dialogues.text: What is it? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I don't know. She puts her arm around Mama and they both watch as Remy leads Kellom out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy and Kellom come out the back door into the grassy grounds of the hospital complex. The lawn is studded with huge, shady live oaks, dripping with: Spanish moss. Some childre'’s. playground equipment stands, unused, to. one side. Remy pushed Kellom roughly.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: You have something to do with this don't you, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: KELLOM
dialogues.text: (backing away) Remy, how could you say such a thing? Bobby is practically my own. flesh and blood. Just like you: are.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: That bullet was meant for me. Bobby was wearing my coat-- that's why he got it.

dialogues.speaker: , KELLOM
dialogues.text: Remy, I swear to you, on everthing I hold dear--I had nothing to do with this. shooting. 156

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy stares Kellom eyes Remy raises. Remy gapes: at him-- the scope of what Kellom's done 113. at him.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: I was going over the logs last night. Some of them have been tampered with--patrol logs, arrest logs, vehicle logs-- all different departments. Only someone in command could have had access to so many different files. That's either you or me. Remy suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOM
dialogues.text: You wearing a wire? his shirt, exposing his bare torso.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Just you and me. Family

dialogues.speaker: KELLOM
dialogues.text: Look, ‘Remy, you don't know. how terribly I feed about Bobby. I don't know what happened. Somebody must. have panicked. I pray to God the boy's going to be all right... But as for the other stuff, why not just leave it. alone? REMY. Leave it alone? Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: . KELLOM
dialogues.text: What: harm has. been done? A bunch of Bad Guys have been killed. It looks. like they ewre killing each other off. Why not just leave it at that? just. dawning on him.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: You were behind this whole thing from the very beginning, weren't you? You had Freddie and: the Mexicans killed, you. ripped of the dope, made. it. look like a gang war -- the Storyville murders. Carmine Tandino, Daddy Mention, thirty kilos of dope. You gonna swear on my mother you had nothing to do with all of that?

dialogues.speaker: KELLOM
dialogues.text: You want me to say I did it? I did it. It was all my idea. And it. was a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: You. taught me a lot when I first came on the force. What was okay, what wasn't. Dealing heroin is not okay. Murder is not okay.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOM
dialogues.text: Any way you cut it there's five million: dollars. worth of herion sitting nice and safe somewhere. That's plenty of pie. You'd be entitled to. a fair-sized slice. Take you piece, Remy. Walk away.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: How can I walk away? This isn't weekly pad from the neighborhood businessmen. This is evil, Jack. You're doing an. evil. thing. Kellom is: hit. hard by this. There is a long beat where he searches. for something to say.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOM
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right, Remy. I don't know anymore. But it's ever now. Let an. old man retire to spend his golden years with the woman he loves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy punches him in the mouth; knocks him down.j . REMY. If you ever so much as touch my mother again, I'll kill you. You're under arrest. Remy reaches to his belt, pulls out handcuffs. At the same. moment, Kellom rolls over, facing Remy with a gen in his hand. At the same moment the

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL DOOR
dialogues.text: bursts open; Mama runs out, shouting.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA
dialogues.text: He's. gonna be all right! She stops short, stunned by the sight that greets her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: REMY AND KELLOM
dialogues.text: . Kellom's on the ground, pointing a gun at Remy, blood trickling from the side of his: mouth. . Remy hovers, frozen, over him, holding a pair of handcuffs. Mama starts running toward them. Remy turns, his back to Kellom, catches Mama in his arms. She looks up at him, pleading.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA
dialogues.text: Remy, what...? (looking past Remy, to: Kellom) Jack...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his knees, picking himself up. The gun is no longer in his hand. He looks up at mama, his eyes filled with shame and regret. Then he runs. Far across the spacious lawn. .

dialogues.speaker: REMY AND MAMA
dialogues.text: watch him go. Mama is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reaches his station wagon; takes one last look back at everything he's lost. .

dialogues.speaker: MAMA
dialogues.text: {calls to. Kellom) Jack! Kellom drives off. Remy turns his mother back toward. the hospital. Anne is standing in the doorway, watching them.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 157 OMITTED “157

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 158
dialogues.text: 159° EXT. ANNE'S APARTMENT BUILDING-DaAY. 159 As they enter, Remy goes immediately for the phone in’ the living room, dials. We follow Anne into her bedroom, where she begins to peel off her blcod-stained clothes. She's: talking obsessively about the case, trying to figure. it out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: We: know. that Kellom has alibis for every single: one of the killings. Somebody else must have: pulled the trigger. Don't you. have any idea who it could be? - REMY. I've run out. of ideas. (to phone) Homicide? Gimme Detective McCabe... All right, then, gimme Dodge.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: But we have to keep trying. Let's take a different approach. Where do you. think the heroin is? Remy? Anne goes into the bathroom, turns on the tap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy is standing on the balcony, watching the traffic on the river, as he talks on the phone to Dodge.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Remy, I can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe it, either. But he admitted it to me, right to my face.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesus!... Did he tell you who was in on it with him?

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Wouldn't. say a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne turns off the tap and, crossing back into the bedroom, overhears. the tail end of Remy's conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find him. Arrest him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy hangs up. He turns, sees Anne. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: iis. *

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: You know that 1 fixed that case you had against me -- a guy in the Property Room owed me a favor. ‘ ANNE, And you promoted him.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: You knew that, too, huh? Before I got promoted, I was a bagman for Kellom. Just nickel and dime stuff. You figured it's the system, that it's not gonna make any difference if you take a few hundred here and there. You figure you deserve a good life, a decent living for doing a dirty job. You tell yourself you can be just as good a cop.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I know. She starts toward hin.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: But. you. can't. She reaches out for him, takes Remy in her arms. They kiss tenderly for a moment, then pull away, hold onto each other, look out at the river.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIVER 164
dialogues.text: A small fishing boat is maneuvering around a huge oil tanker.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: How did those two Mexican smugglers end up in. the Industrial Canal?

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Floated down from Lake Ponchartrain, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: (stopping him) How did they get there?

dialogues.speaker: . REMY
dialogues.text: In a boat. How else?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: What happened to the boat? _ REMY. (stunned ) Of course! The dope is on the boat!... Come on, get dressed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair-of feet slip through a cyclone gate, and run across a deserted yard, dotted with the gigantic eareasses of rusting machinery. A gravel road leads down to. the river, where towering industrial cranes loom over a graveyard of disused blue-collar boats -- tugs, tenders, pushboats, shrimpers, etc. The running feet turn down an offshoot of the dock. : A pair of hands, with a key, unlocks a gate, under a sign reading. "POLICE DEPARTMENT DOCK -- AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL

dialogues.speaker: ONLY."
dialogues.text: The feet step through the gate, head toward a fishing boat, moored between. a Cajun pirogue and a thirty-five foot. cabin cruiser. As they clamber down onto the boat, we see the legend on the stern:

dialogues.speaker: "LA MORDIDA"
dialogues.text: Veracruz At. several places along the side, bright yellow stickers are affixed to the rail. They read: "SEALED BY ORDER -- NEW ORLEANS POLICE DEPARTMENT". “INT... "LA MORDIDA" - CABIN - DAY - 166 Hands pull up the carpet, revealing a seemingly unbroken teak deck. They feel. around and find a soft floorboard. Using a knife, they pry up the board. Underneath are stacks of tightly-wrapped clear plastic packets of brownish-white powder, sealed with waterproof tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy's at the wheel, careening along an endless row of empty and filled warehouses that line the Mississippi.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: How do you know where this boat is?

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Dodge and DeSoto impounded a boat the night. Freddie Angelo was killed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You mean they're the killers? Those two clowns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA moves across the salvage-strewn yard, through the half-open gate, and creeps slowly toward "La Mordida” Kellom appears in the doorway of the cabin, coming up the stairs with an armload of plastic packets of heroin. He looks up, straight at the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Hey, Captain, you're under arrest. The deafening BLASTS of two shotguns. fire from behind th CAMERA. Kellom is knocked backwards down the stairs. Plastic packets of heroin explode, throwing clouds of white powder in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of an oncoming train, conceals the gunshots. Remy's LeBaron shoots across the tracks just before the train comes barreling through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy and Anne come down the gravel road and step onto the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy sees the gate is open, pulls his gun, motions Anne to stay there. As soon as he steps through the gate, she follows. . EXT.. "LA MORDIDA”" =. SAME : 172 It's deadly quiet. Remy cautiously approaches "La Mordida”", slips down onto the deck, gun poised. He hears a SOUND behind him, whirls, pointing his gun -- it's Anne. He angrily waves her away, but she jumps down beside him onto the boat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Don't tell anybody, but I'm afraid of the dark. Remy slides along the wall of the cabin, peeks cautiously around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN ENTRANCE 173
dialogues.text: A thin cloud of white powder lingers over the entrance. Broken and shredded packets and mounds of brownish-white powder cover the deck. Remy steals up to the doorway, kneels, scoops up some heroin, examines it. WE HEAR a GROAN from below. Remy spins, the adrenalin pumping through his veins, pointing the gun down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Kellom lies inert at the foot of the steps, covered in blood and brownish-white powder. His eyes flutter open. He sees: Remy. He tries to speak.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE., (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Put down the gun. Anne turns around, her heart clenching -- Dodge and DeSoto have their shotguns trained. on her and Remy. Remy puts down the gun but doesn't. otherwise move. He's still staring at Kellon.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOM
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... He dies,

dialogues.speaker: DESOTO
dialogues.text: (to Remy) Now the other one..
Remy does exactly as he’s told; takes out his second gun, drops it, rising to face them. His left fist is clenched;he's carefully holding onto the heroin.

dialogues.speaker: DESOTO
dialogues.text: (continuing) : We. had a perfect situation, and * you had to screw it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turned on us Remy. *

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: Maybe we can make a deal... Anne looks at him, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Reny! REMY. Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) That's the old Remy!

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: (motions with shotgun) Climb up on the dock. Remy takes Anne's arm to help her jump across the foot of black water between the boat and the dock. Suddenly he flings his handful of heroin into Dodge and DeSoto's faces, shoves Anne down into the water and jumps for the dock; Dodge and DeSoto recover quickly and fire into the dock just behind Remy who rolls across the dock and into the water. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get him?

dialogues.speaker: , DODGE
dialogues.text: I don't: know.. They're both in the water.

dialogues.speaker: DESOTO
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATER . 174
dialogues.text: Anne catches hold of the canvas cover of a dinghy hung behind a big Chris-Craft. The black water of the river is freezing cold and Anne is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE DOCK
dialogues.text: Remy has swum under the floating dock; he's hanging on to a line dangling from a slip on the opposite side from the point he dove into the water. Cautiously poking his head up, Remy sees... : ANGLE ON POLICE DOCK - REMY’S POV 176 ..-Dodge and DeSoto, their back to him, split up to hunt for Remy and Anne. Dodge starts down slip 11 while DeSoto takes slip 15.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE .
dialogues.text: raises her head above the stern of the Chris-Craft, to see...

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: less than ten feet away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE 179
dialogues.text: drops down into the water just as DeSoto's shotgun blows a great chunk out of the boat's transom above her head.

dialogues.speaker: SLIP 10 180
dialogues.text: Remy has climbed on board a 30' sailing yacht; he freezes when he hears the SHOTGUN BLAST, then with numb fingers tries. to wrench open the cabin hatch. It's no use.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATER 181
dialogues.text: Anne is trying to swim silently below the dock. She hears footsteps. .

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE. HER 182
dialogues.text: Dodge is on the dock, looking into the black water to the right and left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy uses a winch handle to break into the yacht's cabin -- the hatch cover lock gives way with a LOUD CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: DESOTO 184
dialogues.text: three slips away, spins around at the SOUND of the crack. _He starts to walk in the direction of the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy scrambles around in the dark cabin of the boat. His groping hands locate the radio, but there's no power. Right beside the radio Remy discovers a flare gun and a box of shells.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW THE. DOCK
dialogues.text: Anne knows. that Dodge is directly above her, but her teeth are chattering, she can't help it. She clamps her teeth down on the sleeve of her coat.

dialogues.speaker: SAILING YACHT
dialogues.text: Remy, armed with the flare gun, throws the winch handle onto the dock.

dialogues.speaker: DESOTO 188
dialogues.text: fires at the SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pops up out of the hatch and fires his flare gun earefully at DeSoto.

dialogues.speaker: DESOTO , 190
dialogues.text: catches the flare in his stomach. He screams.

dialogues.speaker: REMY 191
dialogues.text: jumps. from. the motor-sailer to the slip and from there jumps on board the next boat, a 35-foot cabin cruiser with a flying bridge.

dialogues.speaker: DESOTO
dialogues.text: is on his knees, screaming in agony, as the magnesium flare burns at 2000 degrees in his belly, glowing hellishly so that his abdomen is lit from within.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE 193
dialogues.text: sprints toward his partner, shotgun ready.

dialogues.speaker: DESOTO
dialogues.text: slumps backward, unconscious and dying; the grotesque flare still burns in his gut.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW THE DOCK
dialogues.text: Anne. can't hear anyone above her now. She swims toward the side of the dock and starts to climb up onto it.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: swings out from behind the bridge of the cabin cruiser and tries to get off a shot at Dodge, but...

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: sees the movement and fires at Remy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tears a chunk out of the lower bridge of the cabin eruiser; it just misses Remy, who climbs up...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLYING BRIDGE
dialogues.text: right at the top of the cabin cruiser. There's a movement in the corner of this eye; Remy twists and fires

dialogues.speaker: THE FLARE
dialogues.text: ricochets off the dock and ares up over the. small boat narbor, bursting into a red star pattern before hitting the water.

dialogues.speaker: SLIP 16
dialogues.text: Dodge fires again at the cabin cruiser, and...

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: leaps down off the flying bridge.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE DOCK
dialogues.text: Anne has now crawled up out of the water onto a slip. She hesitates; should she run for help, stay out of sight, what? Then she sees DeSoto's body and crawls toward it.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: leaps on board. the bow of the cabin cruiser and fires twice at the rear of the boat, where he.knows Remy must be lurking. With his pump action shotgun and plenty of shells, Dodge has a big advantage over... 194 195 196 197 198 199 200 201 202 203 204

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: who tries to reload the single-shot flare gun with frozen fingers as the SHOTGUN BLASTS send splinters flying past him. As soon as it's loaded Remy jumps up and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: smashes through the windscreen of the cabin cruiser, flies over Dodge, caroms off a metal fitting and lodges in the hold of "La Mordida". A fire starts at once.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: leaps up onto the bridge, firing his shot gun.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: jumps off the cabin cruiser to the slip beside it, but to

dialogues.speaker: REMY'S POV
dialogues.text: Dodge's on top of the bridge, no more than 20 feet away. Remy swiftly jams another shell into his flare gun, but... : . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «»Dodge has. plenty of time to bring the shotgun up to his shoulder for a clear shot at Remy.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: fires the dead man's. shotgun at Dodge; the recoil knocks her flat on her back and she misses. DODGE. whips around, and in that instant...

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: fired his flare gun, and...

dialogues.speaker: THE FLARE
dialogues.text: smashes into Dodge's back, through the ribs; the white- hot metal instantly vaporizes Dodge's lungs. Dodge pitehes forward off the flying bridge, bounces off the railing of the lower bridge, and falls from there into the: water. He's dead before he hits it. . a 205 206 207 208 late. 209 2.10 211 212 213 214

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire on “La Mordida™ is spreading fast; flames leap up the masts, Anne stands on the dock, still holding the shotgun, water streaming off her. Remy sprints toward her, grabs her hand and they run for shore.

dialogues.speaker: REMY AND ANNE 216
dialogues.text: sprint up the main dock and LEAP toward the shore as

dialogues.speaker: "LA MORDIDA"
dialogues.text: EXPLODES with a low WHUMP, sending flaming debris up and out two hundred feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy and Anne fall onto her bed (as if they had leaped from the dock to here) -=- roll together into an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: You really had me worried back there... when you offered to make: a deal with those animals.

dialogues.speaker: REMY
dialogues.text: (grins) I told you, chere -- we're the Good Guys! He moves to kiss her. Suddenly the sounds of TWO BEEPERS go off. Anne and Remy instinctively reach for theirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two beepers come flying out the window. CAMERA PANS with them as they SPLASH into the river and are carried away by the current.

dialogues.speaker: ROLL END TITLES
dialogues.text: as CAMERA SWEEPS over the water, down the river, rising, pulling away from the city, to the tune of ROCKIN' SIDNEY singing "Alligator Waltz".
